name: opj_compress
description:
opj_compress - This program reads in an image of a certain type and converts it to a jpeg2000 file. It is part of the OpenJPEG library.
Valid input image extensions are .bmp, .pgm, .pgx, .png, .pnm, .ppm, .raw, .tga, .tif . For PNG resp. TIF it needs libpng resp. libtiff.
Valid output image extensions are .j2k, .jp2

options.-cinema2K fps: Digital Cinema 2K profile compliant codestream. Valid fps values are 24 or 48.
options.-cinema4K: Digital Cinema 4K profile compliant codestream. Does not need an fps: default is 24 fps.
options.-jpip: Write jpip codestream index box in JP2 output file. Currently supports only RPCL order.
options.-IMF <PROFILE>[,mainlevel=X][,sublevel=Y:
Interoperable Master Format compliant codestream.
<PROFILE>=2K, 4K, 8K, 2K_R, 4K_R or 8K_R.
X >= 0 and X <= 11.
Y >= 0 and Y <= 9.
framerate > 0 may be specified to enhance checks and set maximum bit rate when Y > 0.
options.-TP <R|L|C>: Divide packets of every tile into tile-parts. Division is made by grouping Resolutions (R), Layers (L) or Components (C).
options.-PLT: Write PLT marker in tile-part header.
options.-mct <0|1|2>:
Explicitly specifies if a Multiple Component Transform has to be used. 
0: no MCT ; 1: RGB->YCC conversion ; 2: custom MCT. If custom MCT, '-m' option has to be used (see hereunder). By default, RGB->YCC conversion is used if there are 3 components or more, no conversion otherwise.
options.-h: Print a help message and exit.
options.-p name: Progression order. name can be one out of:LRCP, RLCP, RPCL, PCRL, CPRL. Default: LRCP.
options.-q n different psnr for successive laye: Note: (options -r and -q cannot be used together)
options.-r n different compression ratio(s) for: Note: (options -r and -q cannot be used together)
options.-s X,Y: sub-sampling factor (e.g. -s 2,2). Default: No sub-sampling in x or y direction. Remark: sub-sampling bigger than 2 can produce errors.
options.-x name: (Create index file and fill it. Default: no index file)
options.-EPH: (Write EPH marker after each header packet. Default:no EPH)
options.-F rawWidth,rawHeight,rawComp,rawBitDept: characteristics of the raw input image
options.-I: (Use the irreversible DWT 9-7. Default: Reversible DWT 5-3)
options.-M n:
mode switch with values: 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32. Default: No mode switch activated. 
Meaning:
BYPASS(1)
RESET(2)
RESTART(4)
VSC(8)
ERTERM(16)
SEGMARK(32)
Values can be added: RESTART(4) + RESET(2) + SEGMARK(32) = -M 38
options.-ROI c=n,U=n:
quantization indices upshifted for component c (0 or 1 or 2) with a value of U (>= 0 and <= 37)
e.g. -ROI c=0,U=25
options.-SOP: (Write SOP marker before each packet. Default: No SOP marker in the codestream.)
options.-T X,Y: (Offset of the origin of the tiles (e.g. -T 100,75) )

combinations: -POC TtileNr=resolutionStart, componentStart, layerEnd, resolutionEnd, componentEnd, progressionOrder
-POC TtileNr=resolutionStart, componentStart, layerEnd, resolutionEnd, componentEnd, progressionOrder
-POC TtileNr=resolutionStart, componentStart, layerEnd, resolutionEnd, componentEnd, progressionOrder
